item.title: MACSIS
item.description: Substructures in galaxy clusters | Master thesis Observability study using the MACSIS hydrodynamical simulation and Sunyaev-Zelâ€™dovich signals What is MACSIS? MACSIS stands for MAssive ClusterS and Intercluster Structures. It is a project consisting in the simulation of a collection of extraordinarily large galaxy clusters. The total mass of these clusters varies between 1015 M⊙ and 1016 M⊙, making them an incredibly good representation of the most massive, rarest and youngest astrophysical objects that we would ever observe in our Universe.
